title: Nexus Blitz alpha: Week 2 feedback and patch notes
body:
Week 1 feedback thread: [Here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/A6uAU8Yl-nexus-blitz-week-1-feedback-and-patch-notes)
New week, new thread. Since launch, we've shipped a few balance micropatches and added in a new event and reward. This week, we’ll be continuing with general balance patches as the need arises and prepping for the 8.17 release.

Speaking of 8.17, we'll be shipping a larger update than a micropatch. Some of the changes we're working on are:
Map changes (with a scuttle crab in the bottom lane)
Some new events
A new reward
A new item
Numerous system changes

Thanks for all the feedback so far, please keep it coming!

Oh boy, It took awhile but today's micropatch is finally out.

Today we're focused on cleaning up a number of balance outliers on the far ends of the spectrum (either very weak or very strong vs. other members of their class).  In the background we've also been working on a LARGE features that you'll be seeing in 8.17.

The MR changes from last micropatch panned out pretty well.  Sustained AP damage and tanks are a bit weaker (they were too strong) and marksmen and fighters who don't like getting bursted are stronger (they were a bit too weak). 

In terms of overall balance, the power spread across different champs and classes is still looking great! All classes are worth taking, and the vast majority of the cast is viable in the jungle with the right partner!  We're still worried that AoE mages are slightly too strong and assassins are slightly too weak.  May need to look at future class changes to bring them up.  Do note that "too weak or too strong" does not mean "useless or the only things worth picking"

maybe it's not the right way to see thing, but I feel like assassin shouldn't be stronger than they are now on the mode.
It's a brawl game mode and champ designed to killing 1 target then leave should be expected to be the one struggling the most and that's fine.

Having a lot of fun with this mode. Just wondering about King of the Hill placement. Is it completely random or is it influenced at all by where the minions, towers, and champs are on the map? I just had a game in which we were losing really quickly - the enemy team was at our inhib turret and luckily we got them to back off before the event started. It was King of the Hill and it spawned near our nexus, which the enemy didn't even try to contest. We got GA's and managed to turn the game around from that event. So it was really welcome for us, but my duo and I had a talk about whether or not that was really fair - me being of the opinion that we were so far behind that the enemy should've just played around our advantage before pressing us again. I think randomness and how people deal with it is an essential part of the mode, but I also think being given assistance to come back when you're so far behind is a nice twist, especially when the game tends to snowball hard with winning teams being able to win events more easily.

On another note, in the event that this becomes a permanent game mode, is there any consideration to make it Bandle City themed?
From what I've heard, event placement will usually try to favor the losing side

I am still seeing instances where King of the Hill ends up in the enemy's zone or even their base as the first or second event. This is incredibly unfair as this timing usually isn't enough to justify that the other team is behind and deserves a freebie to stay in the game. In these instances the event can absolutely throw the game into the other team's favour and then reward them with one of the overpowered rewards like an immense shield or GA.

I am also still under the perception that ranged champions are quite powerful. Lacking the initiation option of a snowball in ARAM, melee champs are often poked down before they can get close by a coordinated ranged team. It's even worse if one of them is "on fire". Allowing teams to make a few key bans might solve this, but otherwise I'm still seeing a big power discrepancy. Not to mention ranged teams that can easily stack CC or immense damage on top of AoE abilities (Miss Fortune, Zyra, Sona, Lux, etc.). The advantage can start as early as the brief laning phase.

Finally, respawn timers are still too long later in the game.

It doesn't really make any sense to me at this point.

Ryze according to NA.OP.GG has a 45.75% win rate, 43.8% win rate at post 40 (late game). 

 Ryze according to champion.gg has a 44.3% win rate, and a 51% win rate with players with over 200 games on him in plat+.  

This nerf is out of the blue.  This is a terrible idea prior to worlds patch.  This will not stop Ryze from being picked in a pro level.  Since we all know that is what the goal is.  The fundamental problem with how you are trying to hit him is "If he doesn't have a bunch of damage, maybe the pros won't pick him."   The problem is, look at the old metas where Ashe Vatus Jhin Sivir and MF were picked.  Utility.  Ryze has a game changing ulti in pro play.  

Removing 10% ap from his Q doesn't solve anything either.  

All ypu have done is change a basic q w q e q to a q w q e q auto e q. And since E is on a 1.3ish second CD its not even like that 10% is going to be noticed in pro play.

The 10% AP change really only affects ryze during early game to mid game.   When you take into account how risk adverse Pro Play is it wont affect anything.

In pro play its always a 2 v 2, where ryze has a 2 seconds snare at level 2.  Ryze doesnt need damage to get the level 2 kill.  He just needs to make sure the enemy waste spells on him and his jungler can get the kill.

So bad idea.  Doesn't do anything for stopping Ryze from getting picked in pro play.  All this does is make Ryze a joke of a champion and goes back to forcing another rework on him.  So yay.  2 years of playing ryze is about to go down the drain because of poor design changes.

Feedback so far. Aside from a decay game I've only played this mode for the most part since it came out:

General stuff:

* On fire buff is way too strong. A champ like Irelia with the buff will 1v9 people with little the other team can do about it. A support like Soraka with the buff is legit spamming full hp heals left and right and is completely broken because you can easily position far enough away that the increased squishiness doesn't matter.
* Balance for the most part feels similar to ARAM or many other rotating modes in terms of what's broken. Artillery and poke mages, as well as supports are too strong, while 1v1 type champs like assassins are weak.
*Snowball is way too high. It feels like you rely on getting a lucky event spawn to come back.
*Double jungle with a random person is frustrating if you aren't on the same page.
*Game time feels great. I love the shorter games.
*Overall enjoyment for the mode is great.

Events:

*Scuttle racing is really cool, but positioning in the middle doesn't work well when one team is pushed in.
* Positioning for some events feels unfair. I'm fine with events slightly favoring the losing team but sometimes it's just unfair and even can benefit the winning team sometimes.
* Loot Teemo is really fun but sometimes runs around one teams side the whole time and is unfair
* Bardle Royale shouldn't center around a turret. Random Juggernaut choice can feel unfair as well. I wish there was a better way to pick it.
* King of the Hill putting half the area under a turret is lame
* Snowballs should go through minions and the CD on regular summoner spells after it ends should be increased because people are fail flashing still.

Buffs:

* GA and Shield feel awful to play against. They're basically a free teamfight win so it discourages the other team from interacting.
* Rewards like the cannon and blitz hook minions feel much better and promote more interaction and fighting, and are generally more interesting than a big shield.
* Overall impact of the buffs feels too high. 

This game mode is really fun and all this feedback is given out of love btw. I'm glad there's a mode that's quick to play but actually lets me pick my champion. I don't like ARAM and much prefer this mode since I usually queue up with a few champs in mind I want to play.
